context: Among chlorobenzene, benzene, toluene, and xylene of the same concentration, the sensor has a higher response to chlorobenzene. Therefore, the typical response to the chlorobenzene gas of PTA film/K+-exchanged glass OWG sensor was mainly studied as discussed above. This study aims at reporting a new optical sensing platform based on planar optical waveguide sensor coated with PTA thin film. The PTA thin films/K+-exchanged OWGs were prepared with good optical and mechanical properties, and it was tested for some potential interference volatile organic compounds (VOCs), and it showed higher response to the chlorobenzene gas compared to other VOCs. Thus, the sensor mainly tested for chlorobenzene gas. The results revealed that the detection limit of PTA thin film/K+-exchanged OWGs sensing device is <0.4ppm for chlorobenzene gas. The response of sensor was found to be linear in a wide range of chlorobenzene gas concentration.
